title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 May 2016 - XWiki

11:24 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <CylonSputnikk> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <CylonSputnikk> hello  
11:39 <CylonSputnikk> I have xwiki on jetty port 8080 (/xwiki/). I setup apache to proxy to it, it loads fine but several pages 404 when hit through apache (work fine directly to port 8080).  
11:39 <CylonSputnikk> ProxyPass /xwiki/ http://192.168.0.145:8080/xwiki/ timeout=120 Keepalive=On         ProxyPassReverse /xwiki/ http://wiki.domain.lan/xwiki/                             is my proxy lines  
11:41 <lkrejci> has quit  
11:41 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <ClemensR> I guess the ProxyPass can use an option ... lemme check the docs  
11:45 <vmassol1> ClemensR: hi, sorry I was travelling yesterday so I may have missed your answer  
11:45 <vmassol1> were you able to look at the governance change email and reply?  
11:45 <ClemensR> hi vmassol1, sorry, no I didnt find the time ....  
11:46 <vmassol1> ok do you think you could find some time in teh coming few days?  
11:46 <ClemensR> ... did not have found much to add to it anyway  
11:46 <vmassol1> (it's what I discussed with you already)  
11:46 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
11:47 <ClemensR> today is a string of meetings here, maybe tomorrow, if its really important  
11:49 <CylonSputnikk> i wouuldn't mind serving out jetty on port 80 but it won't bind to socket 80  
11:51 <CylonSputnikk> http://wiki.domain.lan/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ works and traversing most pages works.  
11:51 <CylonSputnikk> but http://wiki.domain.lan/xwiki/bin/view/Information+Technology/Internal+IT/Infrastructure/Cylon/Vendors%2FSystems+Support/  
11:52 <CylonSputnikk> gets a: The requested URL /xwiki/bin/view/Information+Technology/Internal+IT/Infrastructure/Cylon/Vendors/Systems+Support/ was not found on this server.  
11:52 <ClemensR> ah  the "slash" problem. "AllowEncodedSlashes NoDecode"  needed  
11:53 <CylonSputnikk> my savior  
11:53 <ClemensR> I also usually add a "nocanon" parameter to the ProxyPass directive to avoid apache "repairing" the URL  
11:53 <ClemensR> I hope it works ion your case, too, I usualy use tomcat + proxy\_ajp  
11:53 <CylonSputnikk> direct to jetty is pretty snappy response on the site but kinda slow through apache :( but that's a secondary problem  
11:53 <CylonSputnikk> trying now  
11:55 <CylonSputnikk> omg i love you  
11:55 <CylonSputnikk> and it's all snappy  
11:55 <ClemensR> ah, it works?  
11:55 <CylonSputnikk> yes  
11:55 <CylonSputnikk> no ajp  
11:55 <CylonSputnikk> jetty doesn't recommend ajp now  
11:56 <ClemensR> not sure about the performance, maybe apache http does some reverse DNS lookups for its log file or the like? usuyally mod\_proxy is pretty quick, even with proxying over http ..  
12:33 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
12:37 <msmeria> has quit  
12:38 <CylonSputnikk> What is the easiest to use side bar navigation menu that is dynamic and I can customize?  
12:41 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:48 <Bertrand> has joined #xwiki  
12:50 <Bertrand> good morning, I'm trying to create an app and I've been fiddling for the last 30seconds, my minute is almost up and I'm stuck ;)  
12:50 <Bertrand> I'm stuck at step 2, because the drag and drop is not working?  
12:51 <Bertrand> i'm using chrome 50.\* and have tryed with edge and mozilla with no progress  
12:53 <vmassol> Bertrand: this is called apps with \*\*minutes\*\* not within seconds ;)  
12:54 <vmassol> \*within  
12:54 <vmassol> (just kidding)  
12:54 <Bertrand> i have xwiki 7 and the error seems to be something related to ClassEditsheet.js  
12:55 <Bertrand> @vincent, I was only kidding too, no aggression intended  
12:55 <vmassol> np  
12:55 <vmassol> I don't know what to say, it should work fine, nobody has reported any issue with this.  
12:56 <vmassol> maybe refresh your browser cache just in case  
12:56 <vmassol> (hard refresh I mean)  
12:58 <Bertrand> seem's better, the icons are now well aligned  
13:00 <Bertrand> @vmassol, ok it now works! I'll try to remember cache refresh before bugging you next time  
13:00 <vmassol> cool  
13:01 <CylonSputnikk> I'm having a little trouble figuring out how to make this into a vertical side panel: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Menu+Application#HPrerequisites26InstallationInstructions . I use the vertical collapsible example code in a panel and I get a nested script error.  
13:13 <ClemensR> I see the example includes another wiki page. can you view that wiki page directly?  
13:20 <CylonSputnikk> I don't see one? I'm trying to use the Hierarchy Panel example  
13:22 <ClemensR> ah, I thought you use the "Vertical Menu"...  
13:24 <CylonSputnikk> yeah i want it to expand and what not  
13:25 <ClemensR> hm, I see no nested script either, strange  
13:26 <CylonSputnikk> perhaps I'm adding it as a panel wrong  
13:27 <CylonSputnikk> I created my menu in the application, but unsure how to add it as a panel. I think I'm supposed to add the menu, which is a child page to the "Menu" application, as a page to a panel but I don't see how to do that  
13:35 <ClemensR> I have to admit I just use the "Navigation" panel straight from the panel wizard and that is it ...  
13:37 <mflorea> has quit  
13:38 <CylonSputnikk> fair enough  
13:38 <CylonSputnikk> but how do i exclude things from it?  
13:40 <lkrejci> has quit  
13:40 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <mflorea> has quit  
13:41 <ClemensR> ok, configuring that beast to exclude things would be no fun. it uses a macro which in turn calls a wiki page to fetch things via JSON ...  
13:42 <CylonSputnikk> there's a mention of it here: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Macro  
13:42 <CylonSputnikk> but i can't quite wrap my head around how to implement that in the panel  
13:42 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <tmortagne> ClemensR: in case you did not noticed: Rule violated for bundle XWiki Platform - Tag - API: instructions covered ratio is 0.13, but expected minimum is 1.00  
13:44 <ClemensR> tmortage: just about fixing smaller things in that part of the code, and did not notice the error, thanks!  
13:44 <ClemensR> it is not happening locally for me :/  
13:44 <tmortagne> the error is weird  
13:44 <tmortagne> 1.00 is a lot  
13:45 <tmortagne> no module have 1.00 coverage I think  
13:45 <ClemensR> especially as there has been no tests at all to start with  
13:45 <tmortagne> it's like jacoco configuration was not taken into account for some reason  
13:45 <tmortagne> I restarted the build, we'll see  
13:45 <ClemensR> so I think I introduced it with my first test  
13:46 <ClemensR> I did not set a default for that coverage, forgot that I should do so.  
13:47 <tmortagne> hmm jacoco is not configured at all in this project which indeed mean 1.00 but I don't understand why it was not failing before  
13:47 <ClemensR> in any case I guess I will not be able to get a decent coverage for a plugin that as no test at all when I started ;)  
13:47 <tmortagne> ha right probably before there was no test before indeed  
13:47 <tmortagne> so yes you probably just need to add setup like in other modules  
13:47 <tmortagne> just set 0.13  
13:48 <ClemensR> darn I seem always to run into these kind of issues. should not have checked in the test :D ... ah, ok, yes,I will just set it to that value and let it be for now ...  
13:49 <ClemensR> CylonSputnikk: you can go to the "Panels" home page, pick the Navigation panel, make a copy and edit it. That way you can at least customize the macro easily.  
13:51 <tmortagne> ClemensR: I always build with -Pquality  
13:52 <ClemensR> tmortagne: thanks, now I get the error, too  
13:53 <tmortagne> [MyXWiki] Restarting myxwiki.org  
14:10 <lkrejci> has quit  
14:10 <lkrejci> has quit  
14:12 <Bertrand> has quit  
14:17 <ClemensR> WatchListJob logs warnings about ExecutionContext stuff in 8.1RC1 - is this a known thing?  
14:18 <ClemensR> it is just the new warning recently introduced, I guess  
14:22 <tmortagne> ClemensR: what does the warning looks like ?  
14:22 <ClemensR> WARN  .x.x.s.XWikiHibernateBaseStore - ExecutionContext and passed XWikiContext argument mismatched, for data safety, the XWikiContext from the ExecutionContext has been used.  
14:23 <ClemensR> followed by an NPE  
14:23 <tmortagne> indeed it's a new check I added very recently  
14:23 <tmortagne> XWikiHibernateBaseStore get the XWikiContext from the ExecutionContext and don't take into account the passed XWikiContext anymore  
14:23 <ClemensR> hm, it throws the NPE in the WatchListJob.init, maybe check if it sends watchlist mails at all ...  
14:24 <tmortagne> (except to tell you that you are giving it a weird XwikiContext and you should check you code)  
14:24 <ClemensR> yes, I think watchlist does exactly that, pass in a hand made weird context ;)  
14:24 <tmortagne> ClemensR: see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13388  
14:25 <ClemensR> watchlist probably does not properly put its artifical context  in the execution context then ....  
14:25 <tmortagne> the problem is that things like XWikiDocument or BaseObject ends up using the XWikiContext located in Execution context whatever XWikiContext you give to hibernate so we ended up with weird inconsistency in the cache  
14:26 <ClemensR> ah, yes, there is the issue - I just remember it from the release notes  
14:26 <tmortagne> so I decided to be full ExecutionContext to avoid broken cache  
14:26 <tmortagne> probably yes  
14:26 <tmortagne> you should report it  
14:26 <tmortagne> the warning is here to find issues like this after all  
14:26 <tmortagne> so you're the first one :)  
14:26 <ClemensR> I check first if watchlist mails get send at all so I know about the severity :)  
14:27 <lanouettea> Hello, I'm trying to find how I can determine the order in which pages appears in the navigation page/generated multi-page PDF. I'm using 7.4.3. Can anyone point me in the right direction?  
14:28 <moep> has quit  
14:28 <ClemensR> multi-page PDF is this an extension?  
14:29 <lanouettea> As far as I'm aware, this is built-in xwiki, and the extension is just a panel that generates the URL  
14:32 <ClemensR> ah, then the order of the pages as given in the url should be the order of the pages in the PDF  
14:35 <lanouettea> ClemensR: Ok. This is probably a good work around. However, I'm using the URL parameters ?format=pdf&pagebreaks=1&attachments=1&includelinks=0&includechilds=6, from the parent page in the page hierarchy, without specifically specifying each pages.  
14:36 <ClemensR> I just check the code of the export action and it seems I am mistaken ...  
14:37 <Denis> has quit  
14:38 <lanouettea> ClemensR: I'm trying to use XWiki to maintain the main documentation for a software I will be releasing in 3 weeks. I'd like to be able to export the whole user manual wiki as a PDF book. So far, it looks great, however, the main outstanding issues are that I cannot control the order in which the pages are output to the PDF, and images in the children page are not in the resulting PDF  
14:38 <ClemensR> at least concerning the "includechildern" parameter  
14:38 <Slashman> has quit  
14:39 <ClemensR> yes, order is only under your control if you add each page with a "page=..." parameter manually in the url. this certainly grows large quickly. the code is in templates/pdf.vm on the file system if you like to have a look, too ;)  
14:40 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <ClemensR> narf, it uses doc.getChildren ... and that is unsorted :(  
14:43 <lanouettea> I'd sure like to controbute, and I might. But at the moment, with the software release that close in time, this is very unlikely ;)  
14:44 <ClemensR> the code for that is in templates/macros.vm ,   #macro(includeChildren $page $withPageBreaks)  
14:45 <ClemensR> I wonder if it is possible to patch this quickly, and instead of "#foreach ($childDocName in $page.children)"   store $page.children in a lost, use $listtool to sort them and then loop over the list, so at least it is sorte by page name  
14:46 <lanouettea> That would be good if I could automatically number pages in a page hierarchy  
14:46 <lanouettea> Like 1, 1.1, 1.1.1, 1.1.2, etc  
14:48 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:48 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <ClemensR> that images in subpages are missing is not a known bug, so if you can reproduce this easily it might be worth reporting it in the issue tracker  
14:50 <lanouettea> There's an error message concerning the image url not found in the log, let me find it  
14:51 <lanouettea> Image not found. URI: https://URL/bin/download/Edgar+2+User+Manual/WebHome/offlineactivation.png  
14:52 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:52 <tmortagne> [xwiki.org] Restarting xwiki.org  
14:56 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:57 <tmortagne> but this issue is not about images  
14:57 <lanouettea> tmortagne: It looks like this bug report is only partially right. The rest of the export works perfectly fine with nested pages. The only issue I see is that the images in the children page are not resolved in the correct context.  
14:58 <ClemensR> I wonder if it helps to include the pages in the main page (just for testing if that works around the issue). there you can better control the order of the childern pages ...  
14:58 <tmortagne> vmassol: did you created the issue from "PDF Page Export with children does not contain images" ?  
14:58 <lanouettea> ClemensR: what do you mean?  
14:59 <tmortagne> actually as vmassol asnwered in the mail he did created the issue based on your report on the mailing list  
14:59 <tmortagne> but looks like the jira issue is indeed wrong then  
14:59 <tmortagne> lanouettea: you should comment on the issue  
15:00 <lanouettea> tmortagne: WIll do. Let me register to the Jira... :p  
15:00 <tmortagne> but the issue you have sounds like another jira issue specifically about images  
15:00 <tmortagne> but cannot find it anymore  
15:02 <tmortagne> lanouettea: does the page export well when you export it alone  
15:02 <tmortagne> not as a child  
15:03 <lanouettea> tmortagne: Yes, then the images are displayed  
15:04 <tmortagne> ok  
15:04 <tmortagne> so indeed probably a context issue like ClemensR said  
15:04 <tmortagne> [xwiki.org] Restarting xwiki.org again  
15:07 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
15:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: added some explanation at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-978?focusedCommentId=91378&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-91378  
15:35 <vmassol> I'm still not understanding why sometimes it works (as on jenkins and as on my machine from time to time)  
15:35 <vmassol> AFAIK the classpath geerated by maven should be deterministic  
15:35 <vmassol> \*generated  
15:35 <vmassol> it could be a revapi issue too  
15:36 <vmassol> (for example if revapi was putting the maven classpath into some hashmap)  
15:37 <tmortagne> vmassol: is it random with the same version of Maven ?  
15:37 <vmassol> yes  
15:38 <vmassol> it's not fully rnadom though  
15:38 <vmassol> \*random  
15:38 <vmassol> but on my machine I had it working and passing without touching the code  
15:38 <vmassol> depending on from where I ran the build  
15:38 <vmassol> but I cannot pinpoint the exact condition  
15:38 <vmassol> and Caty had the same issue  
15:38 <vmassol> she had it working and failing  
15:39 <acotiuga\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:40 <lkrejci> has quit  
15:40 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki

15:45 <tmortagne> vmassol: IMO what is wrong is that there should be a provided scope for xwiki-commons-component-api in xwiki-commons-legacy-component-api since it's weaving it  
15:45 <tmortagne> there is even a FIXME about it  
15:45 <tmortagne> I don't understand why it's not done  
15:46 <tmortagne> then you won't end up with xwiki-commons-legacy-component-api anymore  
15:46 <tmortagne> same issue in xwiki-commons-legacy-component-default for xwiki-commons-component-default by the way  
15:48 <tmortagne> s/end up with xwiki-commons-legacy-component-api anymore/end up with xwiki-commons-component-api anymore, not from  xwiki-commons-legacy-component-api at least/  
15:53 <tmortagne> hmm the difficulty is to get backward dependencies of xwiki-commons-legacy-component-api when building xwiki-commons-legacy-component-default

16:36 <acotiuga\_> has quit  
16:38 <tmortagne> ClemensR: I'm looking at XWIKI-13407 but the line in the stack trace does not make much sense, I don't see anything that can be null  
16:38 <ClemensR> um, ok, I did not look and hoped it would be obviuos  
16:39 <tmortagne> nothing custom on your side ?  
16:39 <ClemensR> plain jetty-hsql, and a locally build xwiki-platform-tag-api-8.2-SNAPSHOT.jar  
16:40 <ClemensR> you cannot reproduce it by triggering the watchlist job via scheduler ?  
16:40 <tmortagne> the stack trace indicate https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/xwiki-platform-8.1-rc-1/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/XWikiHibernateBaseStore.java#L1498  
16:40 <tmortagne> and I don't see how LOGGER could be null  
16:40 <ClemensR> I will unpack the zip file a second time ... uh, its a LOGGER ?  
16:41 <tmortagne> hmm wait  
16:41 <tmortagne> I think I understand now  
16:41 <tmortagne> there is no NullPointer  
16:41 <tmortagne> it's just how the logger logged the empty Exception...  
16:41 <ClemensR> ah, yes, it is a plain exception  
16:41 <tmortagne> sorry forthe noise  
16:42 <ClemensR> phew  
16:42 <tmortagne> but still you can't said any mail right ?  
16:44 <tmortagne> not sure the issue with mail have anything to do with this warning but anyway it should be fixed in AbstractJob probably  
16:44 <tmortagne> (i.e. it sould set the right XWikiContext in the ExecutionContext)  
16:44 <tmortagne> hmm which it seems to be doing actually  
16:45 <woshilapin> has quit  
16:45 <tmortagne> will need to debug all that  
16:47 <tmortagne> WatchListJob seems to be initializing again the ExecutionContext while it's already done by AbstractJob, it's quite a mess in there  
16:50 <tmortagne> half of WatchListJob is about redoing (badly) what it's already handled by AbstractJob as far as I can see  
16:50 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
16:53 <ClemensR> probably has been written before AbstractJob?  
16:54 <ClemensR> no, I got no mail from the watchlist at all ... but will check if it is my mail config instead  
16:57 <ClemensR> ah, uh, I misconfigured the email server to check the fix for  XWIKI-12264  .... darn

16:57 <vmassol> ClemensR: and it's not working? :)  
16:57 <ClemensR> of course mail is not send in that case

17:00 <ClemensR> I guess I should remove my dev instances after every issue and create a fresh one for the next one, sigh
